CT variables adjustable via command line arguments (or nim.cfg / config.nims) to (de-)activate different backends

AxisKind = enum
  akX, akY
Source   Edit   
BackendKind = enum
  bkNone, bkDummy, bkCairo, bkVega, bkTikZ, bkPixie
Source   Edit   
BImage[T] = object
  fname*: string
  width*: int
  height*: int
  ftype*: FiletypeKind
  backend*: T
  rnd*: Rand                 ## Random number generator to produce filenames if `dataAsBitmap` or raster used
Source   Edit   
CairoBackend = object
  cCanvas*: PSurface
  ctx*: PContext
  created*: bool
Source   Edit   
CompositeKind = enum
  cmpErrorBar
Source   Edit   
Coord = object
  x*: Coord1D
  y*: Coord1D
Source   Edit   
Coord1D = object
  pos*: float
  case kind*: UnitKind
  of ukRelative:
    nil
  of ukPoint, ukCentimeter, ukInch:
    length*: Option[Quantity]
  of ukData:
    scale*: Scale
    axis*: AxisKind
  of ukStrWidth, ukStrHeight:
    text*: string
    font*: Font
    fType*: FiletypeKind
    backend*: BackendKind
    includeBearing*: bool
Source   Edit

Source   Edit   
ErrorBarKind = enum
  ebLines, ebLinesT
Source   Edit   
FiletypeKind = enum
  fkNull, fkDummy, fkSvg, fkPng, fkPdf, fkVega, fkTeX
Source   Edit   
Font = object
  family*: string
  size*: float
  bold*: bool
  slant*: FontSlant
  color*: Color
  alignKind*: TextAlignKind
Source   Edit   
FontSlant = enum
  fsNormal, fsItalic, fsOblique
Source   Edit   
Gradient = object
  colors*: seq[Color]
  rotation*: float
Source   Edit   
GraphObject = ref GraphObjectObj
Source   Edit   
GraphObjectKind = enum
  goAxis, goText, goLabel, goTick, goTickLabel, goPoint, goManyPoints, goLine,
  goRect, goGrid, goPolyLine, goRaster, goComposite
Source   Edit   
GraphObjectObj = object
  name*: string
  children*: seq[GraphObject]
  style*: Option[Style]
  rotateInView*: Option[(float, Point)]
  rotate*: Option[float]
  case kind*: GraphObjectKind
  of goLine, goAxis:
    lnStart*: Coord
    lnStop*: Coord
  of goLabel, goText, goTickLabel:
    txtText*: string
    txtFont*: Font
    txtPos*: Coord
    txtAlign*: TextAlignKind
    txtRotate*: float
  of goGrid:
    gdOrigin*: Coord
    gdOriginDiag*: Coord
    gdXPos*: seq[Coord1D]
    gdYPos*: seq[Coord1D]
  of goTick:
    tkMajor*: bool
    tkPos*: Coord
    tkAxis*: AxisKind
    tkKind*: TickKind
    tkSecondary*: bool
  of goPoint:
    ptMarker*: MarkerKind
    ptSize*: float
    ptColor*: Color
    ptPos*: Coord
  of goManyPoints:
    ptsMarker*: MarkerKind
    ptsSize*: float
    ptsColor*: Color
    ptsPos*: seq[Coord]      ## If we add a `drawCircles` in the future, this could be useful
  of goPolyLine:
    plPos*: seq[Coord]
  of goRect:
    reOrigin*: Coord
    reWidth*: Quantity
    reHeight*: Quantity
  of goRaster: ## XXX: add option to somehow allow ggplotnim to store any plot as raster if too many
                ## objects are contained in it. Maybe add a filename argument that will instead be
                ## used? In ggplotnim could check if df.len > N, then produce PNG of only the
                ## plot viewport and then hand that as a raster?
    rstOrigin*: Coord
    rstPixWidth*: Quantity
    rstPixHeight*: Quantity
    rstBlockX*: int
    rstBlockY*: int
    rstDrawCb*: proc (): seq[uint32]
  of goComposite:
    cmpKind*: CompositeKind
Source   Edit   
IPoint = tuple[x, y: int]
Source   Edit   
LineType = enum
  ltNone, ltSolid, ltDashed, ltDotted, ltDotDash, ltLongDash, ltTwoDash
Source   Edit   
MarkerKind = enum
  mkCircle, mkCross, mkTriangle, mkRhombus, mkRectangle, mkRotCross,
  mkUpsideDownTriangle, mkEmptyCircle, mkEmptyRectangle, mkEmptyRhombus
Source   Edit   
Point = tuple[x, y: float]
Source   Edit   
Quantity = tuple[val: float, unit: UnitKind]
Source   Edit   
Scale = tuple[low, high: float]
Source   Edit   
Style = object
  color*: Color
  size*: float
  lineType*: LineType
  lineWidth*: float
  fillColor*: Color
  marker*: MarkerKind
  errorBarKind*: ErrorBarKind
  gradient*: Option[Gradient]
  font*: Font
Source   Edit   
TeXOptions = object
  useTeX*: bool
  texTemplate*: Option[string]
  standalone*: bool
  onlyTikZ*: bool
  caption*: Option[string]
  label*: Option[string]
  placement*: string
Source   Edit   
TextAlignKind = enum
  taLeft, taCenter, taRight
Source   Edit   
TextExtent = TTextExtents
Source   Edit   
TickKind = enum
  tkOneSide, tkBothSides
Source   Edit   
TikZBackend = object
  data*: string
  header*: string
  bodyHeader*: string
  options*: TeXOptions
  lastColor*: string
Source   Edit   
UnitKind = enum
  ukRelative, ukData, ukStrWidth, ukStrHeight, ukPoint, ukCentimeter, ukInch
Source   Edit   
Viewport = ref object
  name*: string
  parent*: string
  style*: Style
  xScale*: Scale
  yScale*: Scale
  rotate*: Option[float]
  scale*: Option[float]
  origin*: Coord
  width*: Quantity
  height*: Quantity
  objects*: seq[GraphObject]
  children*: seq[Viewport]
  wView*: Quantity
  hView*: Quantity
  wImg*: Quantity
  hImg*: Quantity
  backend*: BackendKind
  fType*: FiletypeKind
  dataAsBitmap*: bool ## If true will write the data viewport that contains the actual ggplotnim
                      ## data as a bitmap. Mainly makes sense for vector graphic targets
Source   Edit
